abstract: Eric Fanning's nomination as secretary of Army, highest-ranking civilian position in largest branch of American military, is stalled in Congress by Kansas Republican Sen Pat Roberts over dispute with Obama administration concerning transfer of Guantanamo Bay detainees to Kansas; some GOP colleagues oppose move by Roberts and gay rights advocates are closely watching battle, as Fanning would be highest-ranking openly gay Pentagon official.
lead_paragraph: The nominee, Eric Fanning, waits as Senator Pat Roberts seeks assurance from the Obama administration that it will not move any detainees to Kansas from Guantánamo.

headline.main: Army Secretary Nomination Is Blocked by a G.O.P. Senator
headline.print_headline: Army Secretary Nominee Is Blocked by a Senator

snippet: The nominee, Eric Fanning, waits as Senator Pat Roberts seeks assurance from the Obama administration that it will not move any detainees to Kansas from Guantánamo.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
